LABEL_0: common cold: Rest, stay hydrated, use over-the-counter medications for symptom relief
LABEL_1: influenza: Rest, stay hydrated, take antiviral medication if prescribed, consult a doctor if symptoms worsen
LABEL_2: migraine: Rest in a dark, quiet room, take prescribed migraine medication, avoid known triggers
LABEL_3: allergies: Avoid allergens, use antihistamines, consult a doctor for persistent symptoms
LABEL_4: gastroenteritis: Stay hydrated, rest, follow a bland diet, seek medical attention if symptoms persist
LABEL_5: pneumonia: Consult a doctor immediately, take prescribed antibiotics, rest and stay hydrated
LABEL_6: heart attack: Call emergency services immediately, chew an aspirin if not allergic, stay calm
LABEL_7: diabetes: Consult a doctor for blood sugar testing, follow prescribed treatment plan, maintain a healthy diet
LABEL_8: celiac disease: Avoid gluten-containing foods, consult a nutritionist, follow a gluten-free diet
LABEL_9: rheumatoid arthritis: Consult a rheumatologist, take prescribed medications, engage in low-impact exercise
LABEL_10: diabetes type 1: Consult a doctor for insulin therapy, monitor blood sugar levels, follow a balanced diet
LABEL_11: malaria: Seek immediate medical attention, take prescribed antimalarial drugs, avoid mosquito bites
LABEL_12: tuberculosis: Consult a doctor for testing, follow prescribed treatment regimen, ensure good ventilation at home
LABEL_13: mononucleosis: Rest, stay hydrated, avoid contact sports, consult a doctor for prolonged symptoms
LABEL_14: lung cancer: Seek immediate medical consultation, follow prescribed treatment plan, consider support groups
LABEL_15: hypertension: Monitor blood pressure regularly, take prescribed medications, maintain a healthy lifestyle
LABEL_16: endometriosis: Consult a gynecologist, take prescribed pain relief medication, consider surgical options
LABEL_17: anemia: Consult a doctor for blood tests, take prescribed iron supplements, eat iron-rich foods
LABEL_18: meningitis: Seek immediate medical attention, follow prescribed antibiotic or antiviral treatment, ensure close monitoring
LABEL_19: septic arthritis: Seek immediate medical attention, take prescribed antibiotics, may require drainage procedure
LABEL_20: sepsis: Seek emergency medical care immediately, follow hospital treatment protocols, monitor vital signs
LABEL_21: subarachnoid hemorrhage: Seek emergency medical care immediately, follow prescribed treatment, may require surgery
LABEL_22: strep throat: Consult a doctor for antibiotic prescription, rest, stay hydrated
LABEL_23: dysentery: Seek medical attention, take prescribed antibiotics, stay hydrated
LABEL_24: rubella: Consult a doctor, rest, avoid contact with pregnant women
LABEL_25: pancreatitis: Seek immediate medical attention, follow hospital treatment, avoid alcohol
LABEL_26: jaundice: Consult a doctor, undergo liver function tests, follow prescribed treatment
LABEL_27: irritable bowel syndrome: Consult a doctor, follow prescribed treatment, manage diet and stress
LABEL_28: Meniere's disease: Consult an ENT specialist, take prescribed medications, avoid triggers
LABEL_29: angina: Seek immediate medical attention, take prescribed medications, avoid exertion
LABEL_30: aneurysm: Seek emergency medical care immediately, follow prescribed treatment, may require surgery
LABEL_31: arrhythmia: Consult a cardiologist, take prescribed medications, avoid stimulants
LABEL_32: congestive heart failure: Consult a cardiologist, take prescribed medications, follow a low-sodium diet
LABEL_33: epilepsy: Consult a neurologist, take prescribed anti-seizure medications, avoid seizure triggers
LABEL_34: conjunctivitis: Consult a doctor, use prescribed eye drops, maintain eye hygiene
LABEL_35: epididymitis: Consult a doctor, take prescribed antibiotics, rest and avoid heavy lifting
LABEL_36: peripheral neuropathy: Consult a neurologist, manage underlying conditions, take prescribed medications
LABEL_37: hepatitis A: Consult a doctor, rest, avoid alcohol, follow prescribed treatment
LABEL_38: bronchitis: Consult a doctor, take prescribed medications, avoid smoking
LABEL_39: cat scratch disease: Consult a doctor, take prescribed antibiotics, avoid contact with cats if possible
LABEL_40: tonsillitis: Consult a doctor, take prescribed antibiotics, rest and stay hydrated
LABEL_41: bladder infection: Consult a doctor, take prescribed antibiotics, drink plenty of water
LABEL_42: measles: Consult a doctor, rest, stay hydrated, avoid contact with others to prevent spread
LABEL_43: Sjogren's syndrome: Consult a rheumatologist, take prescribed medications, stay hydrated
LABEL_44: gout: Consult a doctor, take prescribed medications, avoid foods high in purines
LABEL_45: congestive heart failure: Consult a cardiologist, take prescribed medications, reduce salt intake
LABEL_46: stroke: Seek emergency medical attention immediately, follow hospital treatment protocols
LABEL_47: lupus: Consult a rheumatologist, take prescribed medications, avoid sun exposure
LABEL_48: depression: Consult a mental health professional, consider therapy and medications, maintain a support network
LABEL_49: anxiety disorder: Consult a mental health professional, practice relaxation techniques, consider therapy and medications
LABEL_50: pulmonary embolism: Seek emergency medical care immediately, follow prescribed anticoagulant therapy
LABEL_51: hypertension: Consult a doctor, take prescribed medications, maintain a healthy diet and exercise routine
LABEL_52: diabetes type 2: Consult a doctor, follow prescribed medication and diet plan, monitor blood sugar levels
LABEL_53: lymphoma: Consult an oncologist, follow prescribed treatment plan, consider support groups
LABEL_54: chronic bronchitis: Consult a pulmonologist, take prescribed medications, avoid smoking
LABEL_55: appendicitis: Seek emergency medical care immediately, may require surgery
LABEL_56: eczema: Consult a dermatologist, use prescribed creams, avoid known irritants
LABEL_57: hemophilia: Consult a hematologist, follow prescribed treatment plan, avoid injury
LABEL_58: sciatica: Consult a doctor, follow prescribed pain management plan, physical therapy
LABEL_59: Kawasaki disease: Seek immediate medical attention, follow hospital treatment protocols
LABEL_60: asthma: Consult a doctor, take prescribed medications, avoid known triggers
LABEL_61: chronic fatigue syndrome: Consult a doctor, follow prescribed treatment plan, manage stress and activity levels
LABEL_62: oral thrush: Consult a doctor or dentist, take prescribed antifungal medication, maintain oral hygiene
LABEL_63: brain aneurysm: Seek emergency medical care immediately, may require surgery
